title: Latitude IPO expected to be pulled after bookbuild: fund managers
text:
Sanity is expected to prevail at Latitude Financial Group.

Fund managers expect the company's $1.04 billion initial public offering - the biggest in Australia this year - will be pulled following a bookbuild on Tuesday.

While Latitude may have told clients that bids had exceeded the offer size, as was the book message at lunchtime on Tuesday, it was clear the book of potential investors lacked the quality required for a $3 billion-plus company and was at risk of tanking in the after market.

The silence was deafening out of the Latitude camp on Tuesday night which, as one fund manager put it, meant "it is not getting done at 11-times".

So while Latitude's owners KKR, Varde Partners and Deutsche Bank were in meetings with their advisers following the bookbuild, they are expected to pull the float on Tuesday night. Funds were told to expect an announcement on Wednesday.

The decision came only one day after the IPO was repriced to $1.78 a share, or 11-times forecast cash profit, from $2 a share or 12.4-times profit.
description: Sanity is expected to prevail at Latitude Financial Group.
